body_html:
Both TF (via bazel) and OpenCV include libjpeg and build it from source as part of their build. It is conceivable that, if they use different versions, or even if they don't, that there might be global state that is confused between the two.

I also don't know what OpenCV does if the jpeg decoder is not available, do you have to configure OpenCV to use jpeg manually, i.e. define some compiler defines? The test @aselle suggested should clear that up.
body_text:
Both TF (via bazel) and OpenCV include libjpeg and build it from source as part of their build. It is conceivable that, if they use different versions, or even if they don't, that there might be global state that is confused between the two.
I also don't know what OpenCV does if the jpeg decoder is not available, do you have to configure OpenCV to use jpeg manually, i.e. define some compiler defines? The test @aselle suggested should clear that up.
body:
Both TF (via bazel) and OpenCV include libjpeg and build it from source as part of their build. It is conceivable that, if they use different versions, or even if they don't, that there might be global state that is confused between the two. 

I also don't know what OpenCV does if the jpeg decoder is not available, do you have to configure OpenCV to use jpeg manually, i.e. define some compiler defines? The test @aselle suggested should clear that up.
